data.title: Topo Book Film by Jodorowsky Alexandro
data.meta_description: El Topo. A Book of the Film by Alexandro Jodorowsky and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st British Edition. Cover title: El Topo Screenplay by Alexandro Jodorowsky. This hardback book with dust-jacket is in very good condition. Jacket has slight wear to edges, very slight sunning to top edge. Not price clipped. A few spots of foxing to head & outside edge of text block. Boards clean, pages clean and bright and binding sound. Illustrated throughout with black & white stills from the movie. Additional photographs of this listing available on request. Not signed.

Hardcover. Condition: VG. Dust Jacket Condition: VG. First British Edition. VG hardback in VG dustwrapper. 1974 Calder & Boyars, First British Edition. Illustrated with film stills. NOT price clipped. Inscription to front endpaper. Minor age-yellowing to page edges, endpapers & spine of wrapper. Wrapper has neatly repaired tear top back corner and slight wrinkle head & tail of spine. NB. Regrettably NOT available to send to EU countries. Size: 8vo.

Trade Paperback. Condition: Good. used trade paperback edition. lightly shelfworn, corners a bit bumped, some creasing/scuffing/wear to covers, half inch tear at bottom of front cover hinge. there are a few margin in notes and a bit of underling in yellow pen. some soiling to text block.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good +. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. White cloth, slightly faded, over boards with in an ink stamped title in red on the spine, red, white and blue ribbon page marker and red endpapers. This is a very good + copy in a very good dust jacket, with the publisher's lamination on the jacket rippling and pealing. An uncommon title with dialog and still from the film and a large portion in the rear of the book title Conversations with Jodorosky. Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good+. First Edition. First edition, hardcover, has a mild skew to the binding, slight bumps to the spine ends, foxing to the edges of the text block, and fraying to the tail of the place-holder ribbon. Overall, this is a solid, tight, Very Good copy in an unclipped, Good+ dust jacket, which has peeling/lifting with creasing to the lamination across the jacket, bumps to the spine ends and corners, sunning to the spine, and a "Douglas Links" label affixed to the rear flap. The jacket is wrapped in Mylar.
